author: cskiraly
content:
There are two EIPs I would like to introduce here and get feedback on. Not to be confused with the spase blobpool, which is EIP-8070, and I hope you all already heard about it.

**EIP-8077 eth/nonce - Announce Transactions with Nonce** (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-8077.md):
the goal here is to  improve mempool propagation by adding each transaction's source address and nonce to the devp2p announce message (currently txhash, type, and size only).
I feel we are already suffering from having only limited info when scheduling pulls, and this will get much worse as we scale mempool capacity and nodes start to have partial views.

author: cskiraly
content:
**EIP-8094 eth/vhash - Blob-Aware Mempool **
(https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10853):
This is to address a huge inefficiency we have in the current mempool messaging design when blob transaction are replaced (RBF). Even if we change only a few bytes, the whole content is ristributed again. The core idea is to expose vhashes and use these to avoid the extra traffic.
